block.p: Laura Marie Dupuis, a daughter of Pamela M. Dupuis and Gerard A. Dupuis of Chappaqua, N.Y., was married yesterday to Christopher John Caruso, the son of Patricia M. Caruso and Dominick J. Caruso of Southington, Conn. The Rev. Sean McCaughley performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Anthony in Inlet, N.Y.

The bride, who graduated cum laude from Colgate University, and the bridegroom, a cum laude graduate of Providence College, received master's degrees in public policy and administration from Columbia University, where they met.

Laura Marie Dupuis, a daughter of Pamela M. Dupuis and Gerard A. Dupuis of Chappaqua, N.Y., was married yesterday to Christopher John Caruso, the son of Patricia M. Caruso and Dominick J. Caruso of Southington, Conn. The Rev. Sean McCaughley performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Anthony in Inlet, N.Y.

The bride, who graduated cum laude from Colgate University, and the bridegroom, a cum laude graduate of Providence College, received master's degrees in public policy and administration from Columbia University, where they met.

Mrs. Caruso, 29, is the director of management and budget for Homes for the Homeless, a New York organization that provides shelter and educational programs for homeless families. She is also the director of the organization's research division, the Institute for Children and Poverty. Her father is the president and chief executive of Lescarden Inc., a biotechnology company in New York. Her mother, a registered nurse, is the senior vice president for patient-care services at Sound Shore Medical Center in New Rochelle, N.Y.

Mr. Caruso, 25, works for the Children's Aid Society in New York, where he is the program director for the organization's after-school and summer Community School programs at Public School 8 in Washington Heights. His mother, a registered nurse, is an operations manager at Bristol Hospital in Bristol, Conn. His father is the director of planning and development for the City of Meriden, Conn.
